caption: They're usually OK but yesterday we got a half chicken and it was so dry it was inedible.
The best fried chicken Bahn mi of my life.  I like popyes chicken sandwich.  But that doesn't even compare to Eat Gias chicken sandwich. Suriously, you have got to try it!

Chef Sakulclanuwat is my favorite "personality" at Essex Market. She is always sweet and welcoming. Her chicken wings are the best in New York. Flavor is out of this world. The green chili sauce is divine. I wish I could buy it in big bottles! You can tell she cooks with love and appreciation for the craft. Will always buy from her when I am there, prices and portions are excellent.

(Copied from my yelp review)  Hainanese chicken craving sated and then some. I think the name is a mix if English and maybe Chinese? I think Gai might be pinyin for chicken. Anyway regardless this place serves amazing hainanese chicken and rice.  The rice ERMAHGERD! Yeah its so good I mometarily lost my command of the English language, its a ginger infused rice cooked in chicken broth and its as magnificent as you can imagine. I could honestly just eat bowls and bowls of the rice non-stop with no sides. But luckily I didn't have to cause in Hainanese chicken and rice; the rice is the side dish and the chicken is the main star.  So let's talk chicken, bawk bawk. Ahem, I mean to say the chicken also spectacular, it was not at all overshadowed by the amazing rice. Instead the flavoring of the rice further enhanced the chickeness of the chicken. I'm at a lost of words to describe the chicken. The dark meat was so juicy and tender I could honestly just eat 2 whole birds on my own. One minor issue though was that the white meat sections were a bit dry to me however that was one a minor inconvenience because they provide not one or two but THREE dipping sauces. One is like a spicy garlicky soy sauce, another was a slightly sweet soy sauce and then something thats like a salsa verde. All which compliments the white meat so amazing its like a symphony of flavors. My personal favorite is the garlicky one.  Oh and if you order the extremely affordable meal ($9.75) it even comes with a free soup, though its more like a clear broth but hey its nice to get something free and if you're like me you would be glad to have something to drink when you inevitably choke from inhaling the meal too quickly.  Now if you are still peckish after all that, I would also recommend a order of the Shazam Spicy Wings. Now I will say its not quite exactly a thunderbolt hitting you when you have these wings (unlike Captain Marvel [DC]). Rather the spiciness is more like a slow burn that increases to a roaring fire the more wings you eat. (Wait maybe thats the SHAZAM!) The fried wings are amazing crispy and juicy with hints of curry powder and I think shichimi pepper, cause I definitely detected hints of sour amongst the heat.  So do yourself, your stomach, your taste buds and your wallet a favor and like the name of the food stand Eat Gai.
I simply love their food. I always get fantastic customer service here. The place is clean and the cashiers are always welcoming. Will visit here again.
Great kaomangai! Really good, just like Bangkok. Highly recommend for a quick yet filling lunch. Best kaomangai I've had in NYC.
A great work from home much to grab on the go during shelter in place times!!!
Great food. My go to everyday
Truly the worst food I have ever eaten. I'm not exaggerating. I would not feed it to a starving homeless person.

Tried their chicken and rice and fried chicken.  Fried chicken was flavorless, greasy, and way too crusty.  After one bite could not finish the rest which is a waste.  The chicken and rice was OK.  They added organs and liver to the order (i have no idea why) and way too much chicken fat versus meat. The sauces had a strange fragrance and overall just lacked flavor harmony to make it an appetizing dish. Many better places in Chinatown a block or two away.
Hainanese chicken and rice is so delicious, especially the ginger rice. It’s a childhood memory for all Asians! Also pineapple and pickles are perfect match with Hat Yai fried chickens.
Such a good deal. Filling and really consistent. The service is quick too if you need a fast lunch. You get a soup with your combo also. It’s one of the few stalls in Essex market I go to often.
Good at a fair price.
I can't recommend , because me and my friend get the cool food. Why not it hot ? They mad too much fried chicken and put , wait customer coming. Not really good.
(Translated by Google) Chiba after a long time lol Usually ^^  (Original) 오랜만에 치밥 ㅋㅋㅋ 보통^^
Eat’s Khao Man Gai now in new Essex Market. It used to at 6th St. We serve authentic Thai style hainanese chicken and rice also named Khao Man Gai. Plus Gai Tod Hat Yai, Thai Hat Yai fried chickens.
Delicious Thai chicken rice!!! And wish there were more options
Great chicken and soup.

Friendly and helpful service. Chicken and rice was terrific! While the boiled chicken by itself seemed somewhat plain, as a dish, the moist flavorful (described as fatty, but overall  seemed pretty healthy) was great! The sauces added spice and depth. The gizzard and liver was appreciated. You can order extra liver or gizzard and we got some of the pickles extra for 50cents. The gizzards are boiled, soft and juicy and go well with the sauces. Take out was packed and travel well.

Eat Gai is a Thai chicken eatery, located in the new Essex Market location. stall #46  you can order a variety dishes anchored by Thai-styled chicken. dishes range between $5-$12  stopped in here for a quick meal. got the two fried chicken wing meal which comes with a sweet sauce and pickled vegetables. the wings were gigantic. the fried coating and skin was crispy and flavorful. the wings had a good amount of meat. the dipping sauce was flavorful but on the sweet side. the pickled vegetables were a nice bite for in-between devouring the wings. surprisingly the wings were pretty filling and cost $5 + tax.  you can order the fried chicken or different styles of chicken with ginger rice as well for more of a platter meal.  the staff was friendly and the service was fast.  drops mic cuz the chicken is fried right

Eai Gai recently opened a small rest in Essex Market. Essex market is spacious, clean place with a variety of food, and drinks. Very easy to access using the subway, walking or biking.  I tried Hainanese Chicken & Rice, it comes with three sauces on the side: Worcestershire, sweet and spicy. It comes with a free chicken soup which was also very good. I also had a Thai tea, very refreshing for a sunny day. Good place and great price
Pretty tasty, really tiny place, so it may be oriented toward take out. No public bathrooms.
Small place. Limited menu. Good food. Friendly service.

The WORST Hanna chicken I've had in New York... where's the chicken's skin of the whole chicken? I'm wondering, has the owner personally tried the authentic Hainan chicken rice by yourself before? If you had  then you are fooling the guests with bad food. The meat is super super dry and some pieces smelled like overnight, please improve the quality of your food before you make exaggerated advertisement for your restaurant.

If you like Hainan chicken rice you'll really love this place. They specialize in a Thai version of the dish called khao man gai and it's the only thing on the menu.  There are different options depending on how much food you want. There is an option for a regular serving of chicken and rice, half a chicken, or a whole chicken. Everything comes with winter melon soup, cucumber, and rice. They also have a vegan option!  We tried the chicken, liver, and gizzards, which were all really good. Each table also has homemade sauces like sweet soy, garlic ginger, and green chili. They also have great drinks like Thai iced tea and Thai cold brew.  This place is a really good stop for a cozy meal, or for a takeout lunch. I'll definitely be back the next time I'm craving khao man gai!

The East Village is Manhattan's premier destination for exotic, authentic foods from around the world. Even still, Eat's Khao Man Gai ranks high among the most unique and delicious meals in the EV, and NYC in general. A simple meal of chicken and rice has never tasted so good. Their sauces are incredible. The chicken is juicy. The rice....THE RICE! It's far more than meets the eye.  I would say this is one of the best meals available in New York. Delicious, fair price, fair portion, and healthy as can be! Eat Eat's. You won't regret it.

You wrote a review for Eat’s Khao Man Gai A moment ago 5.0 star rating 11/4/2018 The food that we received tasted rich and flavorful. Bryan let us try their vegetarian dish that includes tofu and winter melon broth that was cooked to perfection.  The flavors of the broth was refreshing and addictive that I wanted another cup of the soup. The two different rices I tried was the ginger and turmeric rice. They both had their distinctive flavors and their flavors were enhanced with the house sauce.  I cannot rave enough about these sauces. They have 3 sauces that they make in house everyday ranging from mild to spicy. Once you add these sauces, you cannot stop adding more.  We also tasted the chicken, which is what they are known for. The "fatty" chicken did not disappoint. The chicken with the house sauces tasted so delicious with the two different rices. It felt I was in Thailand eating the street food and I would love to come back with my Thai friends.

Highly recommend!!!!  Tasty and authentic Hainan Chicken Rice. Highly recommend. They have very good source made up by ginger, garlic, sesame oil and some others. Also the ginger rice is very good! But the Thai tea is a little bit too sweet.
Good for takeout; chicken and rice is cheap and pretty good.

Wow ok. Surprised that this restaurant received this many positive reviews. Personally, I had an awful experience. I ordered the pork jerky bun which could have been really good. The noodles were overcooked to the point where I could chew them with just my tongue. Secondly, the jerky was fried to a crisp. I had to chew for a whole two minutes. On a positive note, the Sunnyside fries were pretty good. Other than that I would definitely not recommend it.
Great staff, great food. Pho is super rich and the Thai tea is awesome. Don’t miss the French fries either.
I love this place! I live right upstairs, so it's incredibly convenient for me. But, it's also delicious. I get a thai tea here at least 2 times a week. I definitely recommend it (:

It’s easy to walk past this small joint but I would HIGHLY recommend stopping in! The broth is cooked for 12 hours, and is incredibly flavorful and rich. Also, the pork belly Bhan mi sandwich is heavenly.
